sense.name: bend in an arc
sense.examples: She bowed her head in shame. His square shoulders bowed under the burden of the knapsack. You have bowed the heavens and you have stretched out your hand from on high. The water had bowed the wooden planks. The tent bowed under the weight of the snow.

sense.name: bend one's head, knee, or back to show respect
sense.examples: She bowed. The chief bowed. Then the talks began. Abraham bowed down before the people of the land The Italians bowed the knee to their German master, but they had no love for him.

sense.name: submit; defer to
sense.examples: The school board felt they had to bow to the wishes of the teachers union.

sense.name: play a stringed instrument with a bow
sense.examples: When the main strings are plucked or bowed, the vibrations on the main strings are transferred to any of the sympathetic strings. When a violin is being bowed, the string being played is set into horizontal vibrations by the bow.

sense.name: retire or remove oneself from an obligation or situation
sense.examples: She bowed out when she heard how much work was involved. He bowed out when he realized he could no longer handle the demands of the chairmanship.
